title: Iranian photojournalist shares unseen images of Tehran protests
subhead: Images that capture the scale of the brutally suppressed protests that swept Iran between December 28 and January 11 are rare. Some NGOs report at least 18,000 people dead. Iranian photographer Yalda Moaiery managed to transmit her images of the January 8 demonstrations and the funeral of a man killed by the regime.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
Three years after an earthquake killed 54,000 people in Turkey, legal proceedings stall
subhead: Families of the victims have denounced the extreme slowness of the legal proceedings and the ongoing impunity of those responsible. Three years later, nearly 270,000 people are still living in shipping containers.

title: France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
subhead: According to Paris, the Syrian authorities' agreement with Kurdish forces challenges the structure of the fight against the jihadist group in Syria and Iraq. On Thursday, France's foreign minister traveled to Damascus, Baghdad and Erbil.

title: French judge and her mother freed after a cryptocurrency-linked abduction
subhead: The two women were kidnapped on Wednesday night. The judge's partner is an active investor in the cryptocurrency sector.

title: Director of France's Museum of Immigration History: 'Fraternity has played a much greater role in our history than surges of xenophobia'
subhead: In the face of populist propaganda that paints immigration as the source of all fears, it is possible to envision a responsible and humanist migration policy, argues Constance Rivière in an interview with Le Monde.

European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
subhead: Shaken by Donald Trump's unpredictable behavior, European intelligence services, long reliant on the United States, are tightening their cooperation.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhead: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: The US versus human rights
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
'To revive a strong integration policy, it must become a government priority, separate from the issue of immigration'
